title: Full-Stack Web Applications Developer
blurb:
At Torc, we have always believed that autonomous vehicle technology will transform how we travel, ship goods, and do business.

A leader in autonomous driving since 2007, Torc has spent over a decade commercializing their autonomous solutions with experienced partners. Now a part of the Daimler family ( https://torc.ai/daimler-testing-automated-trucks-public/ ), we are developing automated trucks to transform transportation.

Join us and take your career to new heights with a company that helped pioneer autonomous technology. You'll work with an experienced team of people who are committed to creating safer roads, and your contributions will have an impact on the future of transportation.

About the Role:
We are seeking a Junior Web Developer to support the integration and deployment of autonomous software to vehicles operating all over the world. You will be responsible for working closely with engineers to drive the technical road map of infrastructure operations while maintaining vehicle deployments and updates.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain Web Applications and API's
Work with the autonomous software development teams to provide new features and capabilities
Develop and maintain standards-compliant and extensible code

Core Competencies:

Python
Fullstack Web Application and API development
Node.js, Javascript, Typescript
SQL
Agile Development (Scrum)
Linux Command Line
Docker & Docker Compose
End-to-end testing experience

Preferred Competencies:

Experience with a variety of web stacks
DDD (Domain Driven Development), and Clean Architecture
Svelte, Vue or any modern front-end JavaScript framework
three.js or other 3D web framework
ROS
C++
Object-oriented development

Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field
1-2 years of relevant industry experience

Perks of Being a Torc'r

Torc cares about our team members and we strive to provide benefits and resources to support their health, work/life balance, and their future. Additionally, we are always open to suggestions to accommodate individual employee needs. Torc offers:


Full coverage of monthly medical premiums for full-time employees
Medical/dental/vision/ AD+D and Life Insurance
401K plan with employer matching
Annual learning and development stipend
Leadership development training
Collaborative, energetic, and team-focused work environment
Flexibility in schedule and generous paid vacation

title: System Integration Engineering Co-Op
blurb:
At Torc, we have always believed that autonomous vehicle technology will transform how we travel, ship goods, and do business.

A leader in autonomous driving since 2007, Torc has spent over a decade commercializing their autonomous solutions with experienced partners. Now a part of the Daimler family ( https://torc.ai/daimler-testing-automated-trucks-public/ ), we are developing automated trucks to transform transportation.

Join us and take your career to new heights with a company that helped pioneer autonomous technology. You'll work with an experienced team of people who are committed to creating safer roads, and your contributions will have an impact on the future of transportation.

About the Role

Torc is looking for a System Integration Engineering Co-op to join a team responsible for bringing our autonomous driving software onto our test vehicles. This team provides a key role in the continuous development pipeline, ensuring functional deployment updates are available to testing teams on a regular basis.

Responsibilities


Support the integration of new and existing automated components onto vehicles and test benches
Assist with troubleshooting of component and system integration issues, guiding the team to an efficient resolution
Assist developer-in-vehicle development data collection and testing
Support integration tests, performing closed course and on-road verification of software updates prior to deployment to testing groups
Track full system performance, understanding the contributions of relevant sub-systems, providing feedback to development teams
Support a rapid integration and deployment schedule for autonomous software stack with consistent releases to testing teams
Assist with tracking of system performance KPis on a regular basis
Provide integration issue resolution support to the testing teams

Qualifications


Experience with robotics, or systems integration of complex electro-mechanical systems
Experience using ROS is preferred
Programming experience in C++ and Python are desired
Exceptional problem-solving skills, able to identify root causes in complex integrated systems
Strong communication skills in both written documentation and verbal presentation

Education, Licensing, and Certifications Required


Progress toward a bachelor's degree in Engineering or Computer Science
